New Records: William Contreras stole home for the first time in his professional career.
Key Match Events: Aaron Civale cleared seven innings for the first time this season and didn’t allow a run.
Jackson Chourio delivered a two-run double while boosting his August OPS to .865.
Aaron Ashby hit 99 mph on the stadium radar gun.
William Contreras helped the Brewers steal a run with aggressive baserunning.
The Brewers executed a successful rundown play leading to a 3-0 lead.
Aaron Ashby completed a two-hit shutout with a slew of 98 mph sinkers and a nasty changeup at 90 mph.
Post-Match Reflections: William Contreras said, 'We’re playing hard. We don’t see anybody tired. We’re focused and everybody knows what position we are in.'

Brewers manager Pat Murphy said, 'Well, they’ve got enough of something. They keep posting. They keep competing. It doesn’t always add up, but I love what they’re doing. I love how they’re competing. They’re keeping it in the moment. They’re keeping it pitch to pitch.'

Aaron Ashby said, 'It’s been a grind getting back to where I’m at now, and I’m honestly just thankful. There have been some highs and lows over the last year and a half-plus, and it feels good to go out there and help the team win.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers moved to 21 games over .500.
The Brewers lead the National League Central division by 9 1/2 games with 29 to go.
The Brewers pulled within one game of the Phillies for the league’s second-best record.
